q.a: it's really just to make it work on the staff, because a key signature has to set you up so you have 1 of each letter. otherwise the key of F# would have 2 F's at the same time (F and F#) or the key of Gb (same key actually) would have 2 B's (B and Bb) and it would be a disaster on the staff, you would have to keep flattening and unflattening the B even just to write like a normal Gb major melody. it's really just to make the scale work with all the letters in a row. that's the point of key signatures. it's like 7 people with names A thru G have to represent the scale by holding up sharp/flat signs (or no sign). if you were not allowed to use E#, then the only way to make the key of F# would be to clone Frannie and kill Eddie
q.q: Why do some keys sharpen "E" and flatten "C" when both of those notes are just "F" and "B". Particularly since those notes don't have an actual sharp or flat? Why kind of bullshit is that?

q.a: the vast majority are 100% honest, but occasionaly i might answer a question from an entirely fictional point of view, and it is usually very easy to tell. for example, the last question i answered fictionally was "i love you, will you run away with me." i answered "sure" because i wanted to express a generally positive sentiment for the idea, but the reality is that i will probably never find out who asked that, and the likelihood that we could 'run away' together would depend on whether or not the destination would be a place where there is a good studio space and/or writing environment, and also whether that person would be the right person to form a mutually beneficial and collaborative relationship. the reason i chose the fictional answer was because i felt it had a stronger value to the reader, and also mirrored the fictional (and carefree) nature of the question itself

q.q: Hi Bill, I would like to talk to you concerning your "history of japan" video. Why have you glossed over the atrocities Japan has committed, which are major events in Japan's history? Examples include the Rape of Nanking, the South Korean Comfort Women, and the human testing conducted on Chinese civilians. These are important issues that cannot be forgotten. However, they are not present at all in your video, which has been viewed over 16 million times.This is encouraging the ignorance of the "darker side" of Japan's history. While countries such as Germany have deeply apologized for their war atrocities and engrain these events in teaching history to their students, the Japanese government has refused to apologize and Japanese textbooks are being revised to omit these events.I sincerely believe that you are a very learned and good person, thus I hope that you are aware of this and that with your large following and outreach, I hope that you may also raise awareness of this issue. Japan's war atrocities are not to be glossed over.
